result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jamal Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.   Pay court costs and victim witness surcharges.  ALL  to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 5/7/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jamal Elliott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36  MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 12 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/7/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/7/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Complete 10 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Michael Jamal Elliott not in court, in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record.

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is approved.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentence hearing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in custody.  Paul Hauer for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Michael Jamal Elliott in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
